com.orbitz.monitoring.lib.processor
Class ResultCodeAnnotatingMonitorProcessor

java.lang.Object
  com.orbitz.monitoring.lib.processor.MonitorProcessorAdapter
      com.orbitz.monitoring.lib.processor.ResultCodeAnnotatingMonitorProcessor
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.orbitz.monitoring.api.MonitorProcessor
public class ResultCodeAnnotatingMonitorProcessor
extends MonitorProcessorAdapter

ResultCodeAnnotatingMonitorProcessor will set the resultCode attribute with the failureThrowable class's name.
This is only done if a failureThrowable attribute is present but not a resultCode attribute. We avoid overwriting custom resultCode attributes in the case where they've been set elsewhere. The purpose of this processor is to provide aggregation and alarming on "business failures" vs. "system failures".
For example: 

 
 public void search() {
     TransactionMonitor monitor = new TransactionMonitor(getClass(), "search");
     try {
         // some code
         monitor.succeeded();
     } catch (NoResultsFoundException e) {
         monitor.failedDueTo(e);
         throw e;
     } catch (Throwable t) {
         monitor.failedDueTo(t);
         throw new RuntimeException(t);
     } finally {
         monitor.done();
     }
 }
Will result in com.orbitz.foo.Searcher.search This provides one metric for each possible outcome in addition to "count", "countFailed" and "pctFailed" aggregate exception metrics. For an example of the results of this approach, from custom resultCode attribute usage, see

process

public void process(com.orbitz.monitoring.api.Monitor monitor)
Description copied from class: MonitorProcessorAdapter
This is a method that a monitor can use to notify the processor that it is completed and should be processed. All monitors must call this method in order to have themselves processed.

Specified by:
